byline.contributor: This article is by Tom Robbins of The Marshall Project, a nonprofit news organization that focuses on criminal justice issues.

abstract: New York State Dept of Corrections and Community Supervision officials say they are moving to change how they have handled complaints and grievances filed against corrections officers and that they have begun logging complaints electronically; move was prompted by series of articles by The New York Times and The Marshall Project documenting abuses by corrections officers, who are rarely held accountable.
lead_paragraph: The State Department of Corrections and Community Supervision said the system, which will electronically document staff member misconduct complaints, should be completed next year.

headline.main: New York State Prisons Take Steps to Track Complaints About Guards
headline.print_headline: State Prisons Take Steps to Track Complaints Against Guards
